questions.question: How do you prepare a pure, dry sample of an insoluble salt (lead iodide) ?

choices.answer: mix solutions of lead nitrate and sodium iodide
filter off the precipitate of lead iodide
wash the solid in the filter paper with distilled water,
leave the solid to dry in a warm place.

questions.question: How do you prepare a sample of copper sulfate from copper oxide and sulfuric acid?

choices.answer: Dissolve excess copper oxide in hot sulfuric acid,
filter off the excess copper oxide.
evaporate some of the solution until it is saturated.
leave to cool and crystallise.

questions.question: How do you prepare a sample of zinc chloride from zinc carbonate and hydrochloric acid?

choices.answer: mix the acid and the carbonate until it  stops fizzing
filter off the excess carbonate
evaporate the solution until it is saturated
leave to cool and crystallise

questions.question: How do you prepare a sample of sodium chloride using a titration?

choices.answer: carry out titration and note the volume of acid added.
carry out the titration without indicator
evaporate the solution.
leave to cool and crystallise.

questions.question: How do you carry out a titration?

choices.answer: Use a pipette to accurately measure a volume of alkali.
add indicator
add acid from the burette until indicator changes colour.
repeat until you get concordant results.

questions.question: How do you make a standard solution?

choices.answer: accurately weigh a sample of solid in a beaker
dissolve the solid in distilled water
pour into a volumetric flask.
fill with water until bottom of meniscus level with the line

questions.question: How do you test the gas made when a metal is added to an acid?

choices.answer: put a sample of metal plus acid into a test tube.
cover top of tube to stop the gas escaping
put a lit splint into the top of the tube
if it makes a squeaky pop the gas is hydrogen.

questions.question: How do you test the gas made when a carbonate reacts with an acid?

choices.answer: pour acid into a test tube fitted with a delivery tube
put limewater into another test tube
mix carbonate with acid and bubble the gas into limewater
If limewater goes cloudy the gas is carbon dioxide.

questions.question: How do you find out the strength of an acid or alkali?

choices.answer: pour solution into a test tube
add a couple of drops of universal indicator
observe the colour of the indicator
match the colour with a pH chart.

questions.question: How do you carry out a chromatography experiment?

choices.answer: draw a pencil line a cm from  bottom of chromatography paper
put small dots of substances on the pencil line
suspend  paper in  solvent, making sure it is below the line
wait for samples to travel up paper then remove & find Rf
